content: Thanks graywolf, but them's real computer terms. I trying to fighure out what some of the 'non official'? computer language is. I'm not into texting, but I can figure out some things that are obvious, like "I am 2 & so r u" kind of stuff ... but often I see letters that I honestly don't know what they stand for, and a guy hates to keep asking "what?" I'm looking for a 'dictionry' for stuff like "LOL" (which means "Laugh or Laughing Out Loud" right?) Maybe someone is missing an oportunity to cash in on a "computer slang dictionary'

content: You may want to try this site: http://www.lingo2word.com/index.php RUKM - Are You Kidding Me LOL - Lots Of Luck, Lots of Love IMO - In My Opinion IMHO - In My Humble Opinion IMN2BH - In My Never To Be Humble Opinion RO**** - Rolling On the Floor LMAO UDS - You Don't Say God and the soldier, All men adore, In time of trouble, And no more; For when war is over, And all things righted, God is neglected - The old soldier slighted. Founding Member Original DVG & Proud Member, Rupterd Duck/Derelict Veterans

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: Cut and paste this and see what you find: http://www.sharpened.net/glossary/acronyms.php quote: Originally posted by majorjim: Thanks graywolf, but them's real computer terms. 1) Take your mouse and “click and drag” over the red type GW posted. (It’s a website) 2) After you “click and drag” (highlight) over the website link “right click” your mouse and select “copy” (or “Ctrl C” is the same thing) 3) Open a new web browser window Inside the area where the web address goes “right click” your mouse and select “paste” (or “Ctrl V” is the same thing) 4) Hit “Enter” (or “return” is the same thing) WaaLaa!! You will be at the website GW gave you which is ALL ‘Chat’ Acronyms choose joy each day

content: Thank y'all for these explainations of these acronyms. This really helps! And 'No' mikeyR8, I didn't make buck SGT. I got to SP5 in Nam at the MACV Hq in '68. When I got back I was assigned to Fort Ord, Calif. I went up for E-6 in '69. There were 3 slots open and six of us E-5's went for it. Three E-5 had just reinlisted, and three of 'us' hadn't, so guess who got the promotions. I was get'n out anyway to go to The Salvation Army's School For Officer Training (that's our Seminary). I was ordained/commissioned in The Salvation Army. I've been a Salvation Army Officer for 39 years; became a Major in '90 and everyone began call'n me 'majorjim' and the nickname stuck. I certainly do not wish to misrepresent myself. Just as I'm proud of my military rank and service and I'm proud of my Salvation Army rank and service ... but some keep reminding me to be careful, 'cause, they say "pride comes before a fall"
reply: Thank y'all for these explainations of these acronyms. This really helps! And 'No' mikeyR8, I didn't make buck SGT. I got to SP5 in Nam at the MACV Hq in '68. I certainly do not wish to misrepresent myself. content: Yes, sargeant_green, there WAS a Colonel who fried chicken ... and mighty fine chicken it was! So fine, he sold it all over the USA and now it is sold all over the world ... but he wasn't a Salvation Army Colonel, sorry to say. He was a "Kentucky Colonel" from Indiana ... but it still is "Mighty Fine" chicken Thanks mikeyR8. I wanted to be a Chaplain AND a Salvation Army Officer, but it didn't work out. When I was a US Army soldier I was also a Salvation Army "soldier" ... so I was a "soldier" in two armies at the same time. (A Salvation Army "soldier" is a 'member' of The Salvation Army church). When I received my Freedom Team Salute award at the Pentagon in 2005 I was in my Salvation Army uniform and I was well received and respeced ... until I left my briefcase by accadent in the visitors waiting area ... then I wasn't so well received by some ... duah! Golly, was THAT embarrasing!

Golly, was THAT embarrasing!
